intro: Dumreichera, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a genus of flowering plants in the Malvaceae family. It is native to the high-altitude regions of South America, particularly in the Andes. The plants are shrubs or small trees that can grow up to several meters in height. They are characterized by their showy, five-petaled flowers that come in shades of red, pink, and white. The leaves are typically alternate, simple, and have a rough or hairy texture.
